intro: Humularia rosea var. rosea, commonly known as the roseum humularia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage. Humularia rosea var. rosea prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
